2. The `d` variable is used to keep track of the current index in the array. It is initially set to 0, which is the first index in the array.
3. The while loop continues as long as `d` is less than the length of the array. This ensures that we only process elements of the array until we reach the end.
4. Inside the loop, `last_value` is updated to be the current element at index `d`. This means that it will be the last element in the current iteration of the loop.
5. After the loop finishes, `last_value` will be the last element of the array, so it is returned as the result of the function.
